item.title: Supreme Court stays arrest of ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar in UPSC cheating case - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Supreme Court Stays Arrest of Former IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar in UPSC Cheating Case

Date: Jan 15, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Supreme Court has ordered a stay on the arrest of former IAS officer Puja Khedkar, accused of fraudulently appearing for the UPSC civil service examination in 2022. The court issued a notice to the Delhi Police and the UPSC regarding her plea for anticipatory bail.

  • Puja Khedkar is accused of misrepresenting information to avail reservation benefits in her UPSC application.
  • The Delhi High Court previously rejected her anticipatory bail request, citing a strong prima facie case.
  • The Supreme Court has scheduled a hearing for February 14 and ordered that no coercive action be taken against her in the meantime.
  • Delhi Police assert that a deeper investigation is needed due to emerging conspiracy allegations.
“It's a classic example of fraud, not only with a constitutional body but also with society and the nation as a whole.”

The Supreme Court's intervention provides temporary relief to Khedkar as the legal battle continues around her allegations.

item.title: Mumbai News Live Updates: India set to become major maritime power, says PM Modi as Navy gets 3 new frontline combatants - The Indian Express
item.description:
India Set to Become Major Maritime Power as PM Modi Commissions Three New Naval Combatants

Date: 15 January 2025
Source: Indian Express

Prime Minister Narendra Modi commissioned three new naval frontline combatants in Mumbai, stating that India is on the path to becoming a significant maritime power.

  • INS Surat and INS Nilgiri are part of a new class of warships designed to enhance India’s naval capabilities.
  • PM Modi emphasized the importance of securing trade routes and protecting territorial waters.
  • These ships represent a crucial step in enhancing India's military and maritime strength.
  • India is exporting defense equipment to over 100 countries, reflecting its growing defense production.
“It is important to protect territorial waters, freedom of navigation, and secure trade supply lines and sea routes.” - PM Modi

This commissioning marks a pivotal movement in enhancing India's naval strength and global standing.

item.title: 9A, Kotla Road: Congress gets new headquarters ‘Indira Bhawan’ in Sonia Gandhi, Mallikarjun Kharge's presence - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Congress Inaugurates New Headquarters 'Indira Bhawan' in New Delhi

Date: Jan 15, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The Congress party has officially inaugurated its new headquarters, Indira Bhawan, at 9A Kotla Road in New Delhi, marking a significant transition after 47 years at its previous location, 24 Akbar Road.

  • Sonia Gandhi, Congress Parliamentary Party chief, led the inauguration ceremony.
  • Key party leaders including Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi participated in the event.
  • The move symbolizes a potential resurgence for the party following losses in recent elections.
  • Supporting speeches emphasized the significance of this new beginning for the party and nation.
  • Rahul Gandhi criticized RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's remarks about the Indian Constitution during the event.
"It is a new beginning. We are very happy that we have a new headquarters. I hope this will bring better things for the party and the country." - Sachin Pilot

The inauguration of Indira Bhawan is seen as a strategic move for the Congress party, aiming to revitalize its operations and outreach as it navigates through challenging political waters.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: ‘Mohan Bhagwat has committed treason… attacked the Constitution’: Rahul Gandhi at launch of Congress’s new headquarters - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘We are fighting BJP, RSS, and the Indian state itself’: Rahul Gandhi hits out at Mohan Bhagwat

Publication Date: January 15, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

During the inauguration of Congress's new headquarters, Rahul Gandhi criticized BJP and RSS for allegedly capturing all institutions in India, asserting that Mohan Bhagwat's comments on India's independence were treasonous.

  • Gandhi claimed that the RSS chief's remarks undermined the true significance of India's independence in 1947.
  • He emphasized the Congress vision as one that respects diverse languages and cultures.
  • Gandhi described Bhagwat's perspective as a centralized ideology that threatens democratic values.
  • He warned against the agenda that seeks to suppress the voices of marginalized communities in India.
“To say that India did not get Independence in 1947 is an insult to every single Indian.” - Rahul Gandhi

The confrontation highlights an ideological clash between Congress and RSS, with Gandhi positioning Congress as the defender of India's secular and democratic fabric.

item.title: Watch: Indian Army showcases robotic dogs in parade for 77th Army Day celebrations in Pune - The Times of India
item.description:
Watch: Indian Army showcases robotic dogs in parade for 77th Army Day celebrations in Pune

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

The Indian Army showcased innovative robotic dogs during the parade marking the 77th Army Day celebrations in Pune, highlighting advancements in military technology.

  • Robotic dogs were a key highlight of the Army Day parade.
  • The event took place in Pune, showcasing various military capabilities.
  • The robotic dogs are part of a broader modernization effort within the Indian Armed Forces.
“This demonstration reflects the Indian Army's commitment to integrating advanced technology in defense.”

The demonstration of robotic dogs underscores the Indian Army's push towards modernization and the incorporation of artificial intelligence in military operations.

item.title: 'Sardar Manmohan Singh Bhawan' posters seen outside new Congress HQ 'Indira Bhawan' - The Times of India
item.description:
New Posters of Sardar Manmohan Singh Bhawan Outside Congress HQ

Publication Date: [Insert publication date here]
Source: [Insert source here]

Recently, posters promoting 'Sardar Manmohan Singh Bhawan' have been spotted outside the newly established Congress headquarters, 'Indira Bhawan'. This move indicates a push by the Congress party to honor and remember the contributions of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

  • Posters of 'Sardar Manmohan Singh Bhawan' appear outside Congress HQ.
  • Indira Bhawan is the new headquarters for the Congress Party.
  • The initiative aims to honor the legacy of Manmohan Singh.
"Manmohan Singh's contributions to the country are significant, and this initiative reflects our respect for him."

This move signifies the Congress party's efforts to reconnect with its history and maintain its relevance in current politics.

item.title: Mahakumbh 2025 Live: Devotees take holy dip at Triveni Sangam on day 3 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mahakumbh 2025: Day 3 Highlights at Triveni Sangam

Publication Date: Jan 15, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

On the third day of the Mahakumbh Mela, over 35 million devotees gathered at Triveni Sangam for a holy dip, marking the Makar Sankranti festival. The event continues to draw immense crowds as preparations for upcoming bathing days are underway.

Key Points

  • More than 35 million devotees participated on the first 'Amrit Snan' day, according to UP CM Yogi Adityanath.
  • Naga Sadhus led the procession of akharas for the holy bath.
  • The Mahakumbh Mela, occurring every 12 years, began on January 13 and will conclude on February 26.
  • Schools in Prayagraj for classes 1 to 8 are closed due to traffic congestion related to the event.
“Today, on the first Amrit Snan festival, more than 3.50 crore revered saints and devotees earned the holy benefit of bathing in the uninterrupted-clean Triveni.” – Yogi Adityanath

The Mahakumbh Mela is expected to gather up to 450 million attendees throughout its duration, highlighting the significance and scale of this religious event.

item.title: Delhi dense fog: Over 100 flights delayed at IGI Airport; 26 trains hit - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Dense Fog Causes Major Disruptions in Delhi-NCR: Over 100 Flights and 26 Trains Delayed

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Thick layers of fog in Delhi-NCR have caused significant disruptions, resulting in delays for over 100 flights and 26 trains. Visibility conditions have been severely impacted, particularly in areas like Noida and Ghaziabad.

  • Delhi experienced complete zero or low visibility in the morning, with some areas affected by a cold wave.
  • The India Meteorological Department anticipated light rain or drizzle and forecasted minimum temperatures of 9°C.
  • A total of 26 trains were reported delayed, with some experiencing delays up to 328 minutes.
  • More than 100 flights were also delayed at IGI Airport due to the fog, although no cancellations occurred.
“Low visibility and fog over Delhi may lead to some delays. We are keeping a close watch on the weather.” - IndiGo Airlines

The heavy fog is expected to continue impacting transportation in the region for the next few days.

item.title: Delhi liquor policy case: ED gets nod to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia; AAP says ‘1st case in history…’ | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Delhi liquor policy case: ED gets nod to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia; AAP says ‘1st case in history…’

Publication Date: January 15, 2025

Source: PTI

In a significant development for the Aam Aadmi Party, the Union Home Ministry has authorized the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia in connection with the Delhi liquor policy scam.

Key Points

  • The ED can now take action against Kejriwal and Sisodia under the anti-money laundering law.
  • AAP claims this is the first instance of the ED prosecuting leaders who were previously granted bail.
  • Kejriwal has been labeled as the 'kingpin' of the alleged liquor policy scam.
  • The charges relate to the now-scrapped Delhi Excise Policy that allowed private companies to participate in liquor sales.
“This will be the first such case in the history of the country where you jailed Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia,” said AAP spokesperson Priyanka Kakkar.

This recent action comes just ahead of the Delhi Assembly Elections, prompting the AAP to criticize the union government for politicizing legal actions against its leaders.

item.title: Maha Kumbh: Devotees brave biting cold to take holy dip in Sangam - The Hindu
item.description:
Maha Kumbh: Devotees brave biting cold to take holy dip in Sangam

Date: January 15, 2025   Source: The Hindu

Devotees are gathering at the Triveni Sangam to participate in the Maha Kumbh festival despite harsh biting cold, showcasing their enthusiasm and dedication.

  • Devotees are chanting religious hymns as they prepare to take a dip.
  • Many first-time attendees share their positive experiences and the support of safety arrangements by the administration.
  • Significant attendance with around 3.5 crore devotees present on Makar Sankranti.
  • The event includes traditional performances by Naga sadhus, enhancing the festive atmosphere.
  • The Kumbh is noted to be held every 12 years, with this being an especially auspicious occasion occurring after 144 years.
"It was for the first time that I took a dip in Sangam. After taking the dip, I really felt refreshed," said Nibar Chaudhary.

The Maha Kumbh festival attracts millions, with its blend of religious fervor and cultural celebrations marking a significant spiritual milestone for attendees.

item.title: Home Ministry Okays Arvind Kejriwal's Prosecution In Delhi Liquor Policy Case - NDTV
item.description:
Centre's Key Nod Brings Fresh Trouble For Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia

Publication Date: New Delhi

In fresh trouble for Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Arvind Kejriwal ahead of the Delhi election, the Union Home Ministry has authorized the Enforcement Directorate to prosecute both him and former Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia in a money laundering case linked to the now-scrapped liquor policy.

  • The Home Ministry's approval removes the legal obstacle for the Enforcement Directorate to proceed with the prosecution.
  • This development follows a Supreme Court ruling requiring prior sanction for prosecuting public servants.
  • Kejriwal and Sisodia were arrested in connection with money laundering cases related to the liquor policy and are currently out on bail.
  • Both leaders have denied the charges, claiming political harassment by the BJP.
  • The timing of this development may impact their campaign for the upcoming February 5 elections.
“The Enforcement Directorate did not have the sanction to prosecute me.” - Arvind Kejriwal

The fresh developments could intensify BJP's criticism of AAP as the elections approach.

item.title: Mahakumbh Mela 2025 live: Devotees take holy dip at Triveni Sangam on day 3 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mahakumbh Mela 2025: Devotees Take Holy Dip at Triveni Sangam on Day 3

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Mahakumbh Mela 2025, celebrated once every 12 years, has entered its third day. An unprecedented number of devotees have gathered for holy bathing rituals during the festival.

  • Over 35 million devotees attended the first 'Amrit Snan' on Makar Sankranti, according to UP CM Yogi Adityanath.
  • Naga Sadhus led the way for the holy baths, with significant participation from various akharas.
  • Schools in Prayagraj will remain closed due to the traffic surge related to the festival.
  • Organizers expect up to 450 million attendees throughout the event.
“My experience was good. Proper safety arrangements were made for the devotees.” - Vijay Katheria, Kanpur resident

The Mahakumbh Mela will continue until February 26, highlighting its importance as a major cultural and spiritual gathering.

item.title: Delhi fog: Over 100 flights delayed at IGI Airport; 26 trains hit - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Fog Causes Major Disruptions: Over 100 Flights and 26 Trains Delayed

Date: Jan 15, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The dense fog in Delhi-NCR resulted in near-zero visibility conditions, leading to significant delays in train and flight operations.

  • Over 100 flights were delayed at Indira Gandhi International Airport due to poor visibility.
  • 26 trains were reported delayed, with some delays exceeding 300 minutes.
  • The India Meteorological Department forecasted rain or drizzle accompanying the cold wave conditions.
  • Areas like Noida and Ghaziabad experienced zero visibility during the morning hours.
  • Nearby states are expected to face similar dense fog conditions over the next few days.
“Passengers are requested to contact the airline concerned for updated flight information. Any inconvenience caused is deeply regretted.”

Authorities are advising travelers to stay updated due to ongoing poor visibility conditions while flights and train services attempt to resume normal operations.

item.title: Delhi High Court grants custody parole to Tahir Hussain to file nomination papers for Delhi polls - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Delhi High Court Grants Custody Parole to Tahir Hussain for Election Nomination

Published on: 15 Jan 2025, 3:09 am, Source: Bar & Bench

The Delhi High Court has granted custody parole to former AAP councillor Tahir Hussain, allowing him to file his nomination papers for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections while adhering to strict conditions.

  • Hussain is an accused in the Delhi riots case linked to the death of IB officer Ankit Sharma.
  • The court's decision restricts Hussain's access to communication and media.
  • Hussain's regular bail petition is set to be heard on February 20.
“Filing of nominations is a complicated procedure, it has to be filed by 17th.” - Rebecca John, Senior Advocate

The court emphasized the seriousness of the allegations against Hussain and the need for independent consideration in each bail case.

item.title: As Mrs Steve Jobs has a VIP Kumbh experience, for ordinary Kalpvasis, this year’s event is more expensive – and expansive - The Indian Express
item.description:
Laurene Powell Jobs Experiences Kumbh Mela Amidst Rising Costs for Pilgrims

Publication Date: January 12, 2025, Source: The Indian Express

Laurene Powell Jobs, the wife of the late Apple co-founder Steve Jobs, has engaged in the spiritual practices of the Maha Kumbh Mela, known as Kalpvas. While VIP attendees experience facilities with ease, ordinary pilgrims face significant challenges and rising costs during the event.

  • Powell is participating in Kalpvas from Paush Purnima to Maghi Purnima, engaging in traditional rituals.
  • Ordinary Kalpvasis struggle with increased costs for essentials, with some spending over Rs 1,00,000.
  • Officials have acknowledged shortages of water, sanitation, and electricity impacting the experience of pilgrims.
  • Approximately 10 lakh devotees are expected to participate this year.
  • Local narratives highlight the disparity in treatment between VIP and ordinary attendees.
“We are facing issues of water, sanitation, and electricity shortage... The entire administration is focused on these problems.” - Vivek Chaturvedi, Additional District Magistrate

The Kumbh Mela continues to attract significant attention but reflects growing challenges for many devotees, emphasizing a divide between experiences based on economic capability.

item.title: Dense fog engulfs Delhi-NCR; morning commute, train services hit, minimum temp at 7°C - The Times of India
item.description:
Dense Fog Engulfs Delhi-NCR: Over 100 Flights Delayed, Train Services Hit

Date: Recently Source: Times of India

Dense fog has enveloped the Delhi-NCR region, leading to significant disruptions in air and rail transportation, with over 100 flights delayed and several train services impacted.

  • The visibility in the capital dropped to as low as 50 meters in some areas.
  • The disruptions affected travelers, with many facing long waits at airports and train stations.
  • Authorities have issued warnings and advisories regarding the worsening weather conditions.
“This fog is more severe than we have seen in recent years,” said a meteorological department official.

The dense fog not only disrupts travel plans but also raises safety concerns for commuters across the region.

item.title: Mahakumbh Mela 2025 live updates: Over 3.5 crore take ‘Amrit Snan’; Yogi govt showers flowers on ghats - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mahakumbh Mela 2025 live: Devotees take holy dip at Triveni Sangam on day 3

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

On day 3 of the Mahakumbh Mela 2025, over 35 million devotees visited Triveni Sangam to partake in the holy dip. UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath reported that the crowd exceeded expectations, highlighting the festival's significance.

Key Points

  • The Mahakumbh Mela, held every 12 years, entered its third day amid a massive gathering of devotees.
  • This year's Mela saw participation from more than 35 million individuals during the first Amrit Snan, as confirmed by the CM.
  • Naga Sadhus led the procession to the holy bathing area, setting a spiritual tone for the gathering.
  • Traffic congestion led to the closure of schools for classes 1 to 8 in Prayagraj.
“Today, on the first Amrit Snan festival, more than 3.50 crore revered saints and devotees earned the holy benefit of bathing in the uninterrupted-clean Triveni.” - Yogi Adityanath

The Mahakumbh Mela continues until February 26, with several key dates for holy bathing still to come, ensuring ongoing celebrations for the gathered devotees.

item.title: Zero Visibility In Delhi-NCR Amid Very Dense Fog, Over 100 Flights, 26 Trains Delayed; Light Rain Likely - News18
item.description:
Zero Visibility In Delhi-NCR Amid Very Dense Fog, 184 Flights, 26 Trains Delayed

Date: January 15, 2025

Source: News18

Delhi-NCR experienced zero visibility due to very dense fog this morning, resulting in significant disruptions to air and rail transport.

  • Over 184 flights were delayed and at least seven were cancelled.
  • 26 trains heading to Delhi were delayed, with some schedules altered.
  • The weather department issued an orange alert for dense to very dense fog.
  • A possibility of light rain is expected later today.
  • The air quality index (AQI) in Delhi has dropped to the 'very poor' category, recorded at 344.
"Dense fog is expected at most places in the morning, with isolated areas likely to experience very dense fog."

The severe fog is affecting the daily life and transport schedules in the national capital, prompting authorities to caution the public about potential further disruptions.

item.title: Dense fog in Delhi, zero visibility in Noida amid cold wave; IMD predicts rain for today | Weather updates - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Dense Fog in Delhi Causes Zero Visibility in Noida Amid Cold Wave

Date: Jan 15, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Dense fog engulfed Delhi and Noida early Wednesday, leading to significantly reduced visibility and potential disruptions to flights and trains amid an ongoing cold wave.

  • Visibility issues persisted across the national capital region due to dense fog.
  • Delhi's temperature was recorded at 10°C around 5:30 AM, with a forecasted minimum of 9°C and a maximum of 19°C.
  • The India Meteorological Department (IMD) warned of ongoing cold conditions and potential rain.
  • Passengers faced disruptions at the Delhi airport, particularly for non-CAT III compliant flights.
  • Homeless individuals sought refuge in night shelters amid the cold temperatures.
“Zero visibility has prevailed over Palam since 4:30 IST, with southeasterly winds blowing at 6-8 kmph,” according to IMD.

The ongoing dense fog has not only impacted transportation but also highlighted the need for vigilance among commuters during this adverse weather condition.

item.title: Maha Kumbh Mela 2025: Akhadas lead holy dip on Makar Sankranti, Mahanirvani being first - The Indian Express
item.description:
Maha Kumbh Mela 2025: Akhadas lead holy dip on Makar Sankranti, Mahanirvani being first

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The Maha Kumbh Mela 2025 commenced with the first Amrit Snan at Triveni Sangam on Makar Sankranti, drawing crores of devotees and sadhus. The event marks a significant ritual with the participation of various akhadas.

  • 3.5 crore devotees participated in the holy dip.
  • Naga Sadhus led the holy dip during the sacred ‘Brahmamahurta.’
  • For the first time, over 500 transgender sadhus participated, highlighting inclusivity.
  • Crowd management was enhanced with advanced technologies for safety.
  • International pilgrims found the experience transformative and spiritually significant.
“We are grateful to Ma Ganga and pray for the country’s progress.” - Tina Ma, transgender sadhu
“The scale of the event is mind-blowing. I feel blessed to see this all with my own eyes.” - Carlos, yoga teacher from Spain

The Maha Kumbh continues to be a monumental spiritual gathering, showcasing unity and diversity among participants from across the globe.
